channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Approximately 1/4 cup of material on the ground. The supersak did not look punctured or ripped and believed that a small amount of the powder was residual and was sitting on the top of the supersak. No drains or soils were reported impacted.

item.title: Report X-2024090230
item.description:
Report X-2024090230

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-06T09:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-31
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package came down the IC belt and the IC belt supervisor brought this package over to us after the sort because he noticed a wet spot on the package and a smell of alcohol coming from the package. Upon inspection, we discovered a very small puncture hole in 1 of the gallons of alcohol in this box. We made sure to isolate this in a lined hazmat tote and moved it to the hazmat cage.

item.description:
Report X-2024090041

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR WITH ONE SIDE WET. FILLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED

item.title: Report I-2024080113
item.description:
Report I-2024080113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At the time of unloading, drum was found to be punctured by a nail from a pallet of freight that had slid during transit due to a hard brake of the vehicle. The material was confined to immediate area. The spill was mitigated from further release..

item.title: Report I-2024080112
item.description:
Report I-2024080112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: Durham
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the middle side of the pail putting a 1.0 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.
